name: Uranium Ore Sample #001
description: High-grade uranium ore specimen collected from exposed outcrop. Dark metallic luster with yellowish-green secondary minerals indicating oxidation. Contains multiple uranium-bearing phases.
color: Dark gray to black with green-yellow alteration
geology: Granite-hosted hydrothermal veins with quartz gangue
notes: Collected from main shaft area. High activity readings requiring careful handling. Shows recent weathering with secondary uranium minerals.

name: Uraninite Crystal
description: Pure uraninite crystal with excellent cubic habit. Primary uranium mineral showing characteristic pitch-black color and metallic to submetallic luster. Minimal alteration observed.
notes: Exceptional quality specimen with well-developed crystal faces. Extracted from pegmatite pocket. Extremely high radioactivity - handle with appropriate precautions.

name: Torbernite Specimen
description: Beautiful green tabular crystals of torbernite showing characteristic emerald-green color. Secondary copper-uranium phosphate formed through weathering of primary uranium minerals.
geology: Oxidation zone of copper-uranium deposit in metamorphic rocks
notes: Perfect tabular crystals on matrix. Formed in oxidized zone above primary sulfide mineralization. Potentially unstable - may lose water and convert to metatorbernite over time.

name: Autunite on Matrix
description: Fluorescent yellow-green autunite crystals forming as secondary mineral on granite matrix. Exhibits strong fluorescence under UV light. Crystals show typical tabular habit.
geology: Granite with hydrothermal alteration and uranium mineralization
notes: Excellent fluorescence under both long and short-wave UV. Crystals well-preserved on fresh granite matrix. Collected from weathered outcrop showing intense yellow-green staining.

name: Pitchblende Ore
description: Massive pitchblende showing characteristic botryoidal habit and pitch-black color. High-grade uranium ore with minimal gangue minerals. Surface shows oxidation products.
color: Pitch black with dull to submetallic luster
geology: Hydrothermal vein deposit in fractured granite
notes: Heavy specimen with very high specific gravity. Shows evidence of recent collection - fresh fracture surfaces visible. Extremely radioactive - requires lead shielding for storage.

name: Crystalline Autunite
description: Well-formed autunite crystals displaying perfect tetragonal symmetry. Bright fluorescent green color with excellent transparency. Some crystals show twinning.
color: Bright lime green with adamantine luster
notes: Museum-quality crystals with exceptional clarity. Strong UV fluorescence makes this specimen ideal for demonstrations. No visible alteration or weathering.
